intro: Pentameris macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered star-hair, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets, typical of the genus Pentameris. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
